Package com.hissain.jscipy

Class Signal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.Signal
  • public class Signal
extends java.lang.Object
    A facade class providing static utility methods for signal processing, similar to scipy.signal. This class delegates to specific implementations within the library.

    For general mathematical operations (interpolation, resampling), see Math.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      • filtfilt

        public static double[] filtfilt​(double[] signal,
                                double sampleRate,
                                double cutoff,
                                int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Butterworth low-pass filter (forward and backward).
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • lfilter

                               double sampleRate,

                               int order)
        Applies a standard (causal) Butterworth low-pass filter.
        Parameters:

      • filtfilt_highpass

        public static double[] filtfilt_highpass​(double[] signal,
                                         double sampleRate,
                                         double cutoff,
                                         int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Butterworth high-pass filter (forward and backward).

        High-pass filtering removes low-frequency components below the cutoff frequency.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • filtfilt_bandpass

        public static double[] filtfilt_bandpass​(double[] signal,
                                         double sampleRate,
                                         double centerFrequency,
                                         double bandwidth,
                                         int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Butterworth band-pass filter (forward and backward).

        Band-pass filtering allows frequencies within a specified range to pass through while attenuating frequencies outside that range.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        centerFrequency - The center frequency of the passband in Hz.
        bandwidth - The width of the passband in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • filtfilt_bandstop

        public static double[] filtfilt_bandstop​(double[] signal,
                                         double sampleRate,
                                         double centerFrequency,
                                         double bandwidth,
                                         int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Butterworth band-stop (notch) filter (forward and backward).

        Band-stop filtering attenuates frequencies within a specified range while allowing frequencies outside that range to pass through.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        centerFrequency - The center frequency of the stopband in Hz.
        bandwidth - The width of the stopband in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • cheby1_filtfilt

                                       int order,

        Applies a zero-phase Chebyshev Type I low-pass filter (forward and backward).
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
        order - The filter order.
        rippleDb - The passband ripple in decibels.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • bessel_filtfilt_highpass

        public static double[] bessel_filtfilt_highpass​(double[] signal,
                                                double sampleRate,
                                                double cutoff,
                                                int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Bessel high-pass filter (forward and backward).

        High-pass filtering removes low-frequency components below the cutoff frequency. Bessel filters are optimized for linear phase response.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • bessel_filtfilt_bandpass

        public static double[] bessel_filtfilt_bandpass​(double[] signal,
                                                double sampleRate,
                                                double lowCutoff,
                                                double highCutoff,
                                                int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Bessel band-pass filter (forward and backward).

        Band-pass filtering allows frequencies within a specified range to pass through. Bessel filters are optimized for linear phase response.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        lowCutoff - The lower cutoff frequency in Hz.
        highCutoff - The upper cutoff frequency in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • bessel_filtfilt_bandstop

        public static double[] bessel_filtfilt_bandstop​(double[] signal,
                                                double sampleRate,
                                                double lowCutoff,
                                                double highCutoff,
                                                int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Bessel band-stop (notch) filter (forward and backward).

        Band-stop filtering attenuates frequencies within a specified range. Bessel filters are optimized for linear phase response.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in Hz.
        lowCutoff - The lower cutoff frequency in Hz.
        highCutoff - The upper cutoff frequency in Hz.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • firwin

        public static double[] firwin​(int numtaps,
                              double[] cutoff,
                              double fs,
                              boolean pass_zero)
        Design an FIR filter using the window method. Default window is "hamming".
        Parameters:
        numtaps - The number of taps.
        cutoff - Cutoff frequency (Hz). Scalar or array.
        fs - Sampling frequency (Hz).
        pass_zero - If true, the zero frequency is passed (Lowpass, Bandstop). If false, the zero frequency is stopped (Highpass, Bandpass).
        Returns:
        Filter coefficients.

      • firwin_lowpass

        public static double[] firwin_lowpass​(int numtaps,
                                      double cutoff,
                                      double fs)
        Design a Lowpass FIR filter.
        Parameters:
        numtaps - The number of taps.
        cutoff - Cutoff frequency (Hz).
        fs - Sampling frequency (Hz).
        Returns:
        Filter coefficients.

      • firwin_highpass

        public static double[] firwin_highpass​(int numtaps,
                                       double cutoff,
                                       double fs)
        Design a Highpass FIR filter.
        Parameters:
        numtaps - The number of taps.
        cutoff - Cutoff frequency (Hz).
        fs - Sampling frequency (Hz).
        Returns:
        Filter coefficients.

      • firwin_bandpass

        public static double[] firwin_bandpass​(int numtaps,
                                       double low,
                                       double high,
                                       double fs)
        Design a Bandpass FIR filter.
        Parameters:
        numtaps - The number of taps.
        low - Lower cutoff frequency (Hz).
        high - Upper cutoff frequency (Hz).
        fs - Sampling frequency (Hz).
        Returns:
        Filter coefficients.

      • sosfilt

        public static double[] sosfilt​(double[] signal,
                               double[][] sos)
        Filter data using a series of second-order sections (SOS).
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sos - Array of second-order sections of shape [n_sections][6]. Each section includes [b0, b1, b2, a0, a1, a2].
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • padSignal

        public static double[] padSignal​(double[] x,
                                 int padlen)
        Pads a signal using odd extension at both ends.

        This extension mode (also known as "reflective" or "antisymmetric" padding) creates a smooth transition at the boundaries, which is useful for filtering operations to reduce edge artifacts.

        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        padlen - The number of samples to pad on both sides.
        Returns:
        The padded signal with length x.length + 2 * padlen.

                               DetrendType type)

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        type - The type of detrending (LINEAR or CONSTANT).
        Returns:
        The detrended signal.

      • find_peaks

        public static int[] find_peaks​(double[] x,
                               double height,
                               int distance,
                               double prominence)
        Finds peaks in a signal with optional parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        height - Minimum height of peaks (optional, Double.NaN to ignore).
        distance - Minimum distance between peaks (optional, -1 to ignore).
        prominence - Minimum prominence of peaks (optional, Double.NaN to ignore).
        Returns:
        The indices of found peaks.

                               boolean symmetric)
        Returns a Hanning window of length M.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the window.
        symmetric - If true, generates a symmetric window (for filter design). If false, generates a periodic window (for spectral analysis).
        Returns:
        The Hanning window.

      • welch

        public static Welch.WelchResult welch​(double[] x,
                                      double fs,
                                      int nperseg)
        Compute Power Spectral Density using Welch's method. Uses default Hanning window and 50% overlap.
        Parameters:
        x - Input signal.
        fs - Sampling frequency.
        nperseg - Length of each segment.
        Returns:
        WelchResult containing frequency array (f) and PSD array (Pxx).

      • savgol_filter

        public static double[] savgol_filter​(double[] x,
                                     int windowLength,
                                     int polyOrder,
                                     int deriv,
                                     double delta)
        Applies a Savitzky-Golay filter to an array.
        Parameters:
        x - The data to be filtered.
        windowLength - The length of the filter window (i.e., the number of coefficients). window_length must be a positive odd integer.
        polyOrder - The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples. polyorder must be less than window_length.
        deriv - The order of the derivative to compute. This must be a non-negative integer. The default is 0, which means to filter the data.
        delta - The spacing of the samples to which the filter will be applied. This is only used if deriv > 0. Default is 1.0.
        Returns:
        The filtered data.

      • savgol_filter

        public static double[] savgol_filter​(double[] x,
                                     int windowLength,
                                     int polyOrder)
        Applies a Savitzky-Golay filter to an array (smoothing, derivative=0).
        Parameters:
        x - The data to be filtered.
        windowLength - The length of the filter window.
        polyOrder - The order of the polynomial.
        Returns:
        The filtered (smoothed) data.

                               int kernelSize)

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        kernelSize - The size of the kernel (must be odd).
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • convolve

        public static double[] convolve​(double[] signal,
                                double[] window,
                                ConvolutionMode mode)
        Convolves two signals using the specified mode.
        Parameters:

        window - The second signal (window).
        mode - The convolution mode (e.g., ConvolutionMode.SAME).
        Returns:
        The convolved signal.

      • correlate

        public static double[] correlate​(double[] in1,
                                 double[] in2,
                                 ConvolutionMode mode)
        Cross-correlate two 1-dimensional sequences.

        This function computes the correlation as generally defined in signal processing texts: z[k] = (x * y)[k] = sum_l x[l] * y[l+k]

        This is equivalent to convolve(in1, reverse(in2), mode).

        Parameters:
        in1 - First input signal.
        in2 - Second input signal.
        mode - The convolution mode (FULL, SAME, VALID).
        Returns:
        Discrete cross-correlation of in1 and in2.

      • convolve2d

        public static double[][] convolve2d​(double[][] in1,
                                    double[][] in2,
                                    ConvolutionMode mode)
        Convolves two 2D signals using the specified mode.
        Parameters:
        in1 - The first input array.
        in2 - The second input array.
        mode - The convolution mode (FULL, VALID, SAME).
        Returns:
        The convolved 2D array.

      • spectrogram

        public static Spectrogram.SpectrogramResult spectrogram​(double[] signal,
                                                        double fs)
        Computes the spectrogram of a signal.

        Spectrograms can be used as a way of visualizing the change of a nonstationary signal's frequency content over time.

        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal (time series).
        fs - The sampling frequency of the signal in Hz.
        Returns:
        A Spectrogram.SpectrogramResult containing sample frequencies, segment times, and the spectrogram (power spectral density).

      • stft

        public static JComplex[][] stft​(double[] x)
        Compute the Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT).

        Uses default parameters: nperseg=256, noverlap=128, Hann window.

        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        2D complex array [frequency bins][time frames].

      • istft

        public static double[] istft​(JComplex[][] stftMatrix)
        Compute the Inverse Short-Time Fourier Transform (ISTFT).
        Parameters:
        stftMatrix - 2D complex array [frequency bins][time frames].
        Returns:
        Reconstructed time-domain signal.

      • dct

        public static double[] dct​(double[] x)
        Compute the 1D Discrete Cosine Transform (Type-II). Matches scipy.fft.dct(x, type=2, norm=None).

        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        The transform coefficients (unnormalized).

      • idct

        public static double[] idct​(double[] x)
        Compute the 1D Inverse Discrete Cosine Transform (Type-II). Matches scipy.fft.idct(x, type=2, norm=None).

        Parameters:
        x - The input DCT coefficients.
        Returns:
        The reconstructed signal.

      • dct

        public static double[] dct​(double[] x,
                           boolean ortho)
        Compute the 1D Discrete Cosine Transform (Type-II) with optional orthogonality normalization.

        If ortho is true, the result is scaled by:

        • sqrt(1 / (4N)) for k = 0
        • sqrt(1 / (2N)) for k > 0
        This makes the DCT orthonormal.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal array.
        ortho - If true, applies orthogonality normalization (matches scipy norm='ortho').
        Returns:
        The transformed coefficients array of length N.

      • periodogram

        public static Periodogram.PeriodogramResult periodogram​(double[] x,
                                                        double fs)
        Estimate power spectral density using a periodogram.

        Matches scipy.signal.periodogram with default Hann window and 'density' scaling.

        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        fs - The sampling frequency in Hz.
        Returns:
        PeriodogramResult containing frequencies and PSD.
